title: Gustavo Almeida Silva
text:
Product Risk Analyst Intern - Ita√∫ Unibanco

üìö Statistician - Federal University of Juiz de Fora
üíπ Time Series Models Researcher (ARIMA, GLARMA, INGARCH and NNETAR) for epidemiological forecast
üìä Statistical Consultant for Postgraduate Students



I am a statistics student at the Federal University of Juiz de Fora, currently in the final period of the program. As a Scientific Initiation Fellow on the social and epidemiological data analysis platform JF Salvando Todos, i have gained experience in automated data collection and cleaning, creating web pages with RShiny, and data analysis and modeling. Also worked with inference and prediction of epidemiological data using time series models, creating the R package fableCount. Currently working on Ita√∫ Unibanco as a intern in the product risk analysis area





LASSO AdaLASSO e WLAdaLASSO for Time Series
fableCount 2.0, a new forecast era



fableCount | Count Time Series Modelling | 2024
Mmcsd | Modeling Complex Longitudinal Data | 2023

title: Gustavo Almeida Silva
text: I am a statistics student at the Federal University of Juiz de Fora, currently in the final period of the program. As a Scientific Initiation Fellow on the social and epidemiological data analysis platform JF Salvando Todos, i have gained experience in automated data collection and cleaning, creating web pages with RShiny, and data analysis and modeling. Also worked with inference and prediction of epidemiological data using time series models, creating the R package fableCount. title: R Packages
text:
This page contains the R packages developed during the my undergraduate period


The fableCount R package aims to offer counting time series models for users of the fable framework. These models work within the fable framework, which provides the tools to evaluate, visualize, and combine models in a workflow consistent with the tidyverse.

fableCount - Official Site
fableCount - CRAN Reference




Abbreviation for Multivariate Models for Complex Survey Data. Matching longitudinal methodology models with complex sampling design. It fits fixed and random effects models and covariance structured models so far. It also provides tools to perform statistical tests considering these specifications as described in : Pacheco, P. H. (2021). ‚ÄúModeling complex longitudinal data in R: development of a statistical package https://repositorio.ufjf.br/jspui/bitstream/ufjf/13437/1/pedrohenriquedemesquitapacheco.pdf

Mmcsd - CRAN Reference
Mmcsd - Official Vignette
